TopicTitle: Anybody have a spare anitmatter drive lying around?

Articles.Content: Not entirely sure I can do it even with the power of E=MC^2...
Yeah, there's one in my junkyard. You pay you pull.

2 years to get to pluto, and enough dV to insert into orbit once there?

Yea, no problem, E=MC^2 can do that for you... now where did I leave that Orion Drive... you won't need my antimatter drive...
KSP Interstellar Got several engines which can do it

Pluto is in RP-0 what Pol is in stock career. That time limit though...

You should visit Krakendyne's store, they sure have something for you.
I think you mean "Warp Drive". A portable wormhole might work, too.
Use this. I heard ride is awesome.
Those two year Pluto missions started showing up right after I did my first Moon contract. I think the game is trying to tell me to hurry up and finish the tech tree...

It's no problem so long as the final satellite consists of only an antenna stuck to an RTG, i.e., light.

But seriously, ouch.

It's no problem so long as the final satellite consists of only an antenna stuck to an RTG, i.e., light.

But seriously, ouch.

Don't think its so easy to get into Pluto orbit in 11 years even with an small probe.

Perhaps ion first stage, the ion+ fuel cells might work for braking however it will be activate mechjeb and go to work type of burns.

http://i.imgur.com/RfLSNX6.png

An Orion would get to Pluto in a couple of years but it would probably cost you some million funds in fuel.
